Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates Joe Biden's statement by suggesting that he said "not one person would have died from COVID-19" if he were president.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that Joe Biden made the specific statement mentioned.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Joe Biden made a definitive statement about preventing all COVID-19 deaths if he were president, which is not supported by the available information.
Exist alternative explanation: Experts provide alternative explanations, stating that it would be impossible to prevent 100% of COVID-19 deaths and that even countries with successful pandemic responses have experienced some fatalities.
